results.title: I dream of peace and rest: Norman Lindsay
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Dale McCrea
results.brief_description: The opening of Norman Lindsay’s house by the National Trust. The house exhibits work by Norman Lindsay, including sculpture in the gardens. Lindsay’s thoughts and reflections on his life and work are heard, and many of his works of art are shown. Narrated by Margaret Throsby and Don Reid.

results.title: I Don't kiss = J'embrasse pas
results.creator_credit: Bac Films (France), Cine Cinq, Gruppo Bruno, President Films, Salome, Maurice Bernart, Jacques-Eric Strauss, Jean Labadie and Andre Techine
results.brief_description: Manuel Blanc is Pierre, a young provincial adolescent who leaves his village to settle in Paris and become an actor. However, the big city proves difficult and expensive and when Pierre loses his job as a hospital orderly he soon finds himself working as a street prostitute. As his dreams disappear and his soul becomes hardened, it is only through his love for the enigmatic Ingrid (Emmanuelle Beart), who also works the streets, that Pierre can hold on to any aspirations for beauty and love. But Ingrid belongs to her pimp and Pierre’s desire soon leads to an inevitable tragic conclusion. Utilising the conventions of melodrama - including the cliched story of the “whore with the heart of gold” - Techine builds a compelling and gritty story of underclass life on the streets. Shifting from almost documentary style examination of the lives of the hustlers, junkies and criminals in the Paris underworld, to highly expressionistic colours and mise-en-scene for the fragile love affair between Pierre and Ingrid, “I Don’t Kiss” becomes a rhapsodic and moving account of the damages inflicted by both poverty and fate. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: I Claudius. Parts III and IV
results.brief_description: Claudius continues the history of his diabolical family. Plunged further into madness, Caligula imagines himself to be the most divine god of Rome. The power he wields causes him to act with cruelty and tyranny. Ultimately he is murdered by those no longer willing to suffer injustice. Claudius, the “old fool”, is reluctantly elected Emperor as prophesised. In Part IV, Claudius married to the cunning, unfaithful Messalina, rules wisely but longs for the Republic. These programs contain scenes of violence and nudity.

results.title: I Claudius. Parts I and II
results.brief_description: Claudius reflects on the history of his family at the twilight of his life. Claudius - lame, a stutterer and considered a fool, manages to stay alive during the turbulent times of the early emperors of Rome. Here his evil grandmother Livia, married to Emperor Augustus, poisons her enemies, his uncle Tiberius runs a depraved court and his nephew Caligula sinks into a madness which manifests itself in unspeakable cruelties. Claudius seeks to tell the truth about the good and bad apples of his family tree. Derek Jacobi as Claudius, Sian Phillips as Livia received British Academy Awards. Also stars Brian Blessed as Augustus and John Hurt as Caligula.

results.title: I Can take care of myself
results.brief_description: Samantha is having a hard time getting used to the idea that she should not only keep herself neat and tidy, but she should also take care of her room, as she say, “Why should I clean things when they just get dirty again?” Suddenly, while she is pondering this age-old question, her stuffed penguin comes to life and shows Sam the value of keeping yourself and your surroundings clear and clean. This video examines the important topics of personal hygiene, grooming and keeping things neat and in order, as well as family teamwork and respect for family members. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included. No other credits available.

results.title: I can make music
results.creator_credit: New South Wales Film Corporation, Ursula Kolbe and Tom Zubrycki
results.brief_description: Shows various methods of working with children, including the Orff method, which involves young children in actively responding to music. Highlights movement to music and the music of different cultures from places such as Mexico and South America. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: I Can make friends
results.brief_description: Through following Zip and his talking dog Max as they meet their new neighbour Missy, children will learn how to make new friends and be better communicators. Areas covered include introducing themselves, beginning and ending a conversation, recognising the value of telling the truth, giving and receiving a compliment, sharing and apologising. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teachers guide included.

results.title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 9
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, John Gauci and Douglas Sharp
results.brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. Times are tough and the economy is failing. When the factory heads agree that the only way to save costs is to downsize, Alan must use all his abilities to try and save the jobs of his friends in the factory. Eventually Alan decides to leave and return to the country to begin his career as a writer.
